image.altText: A man walks through journalists and cameras.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann has widened his appeal against the result of his failed defamation case, which he launched over an interview conducted on Network Ten between journalist Lisa Wilkinson and Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann widens his appeal against defamation case ruling

image.altText: Sign in front of Canberra Hospital

props.synopsis: The ACT Coroner finds failures in delivery and later treatment led to the death of a newborn baby in the neonatal unit at the Canberra Hospital in 2017.

title.children: Failures in treatment led to death of newborn baby at Canberra Hospital, coroner finds

image.altText: Ceramic sculptures of a man walking eight dogs.

props.synopsis: Dharug artist Billy Bain's work is part of the National Gallery's 'Ever Present' exhibition, where more than 260 works will be the largest display of Indigenous art in Canberra.

title.children: After starting during lockdown, Billy and his dogs are now part of Canberra's largest Indigenous art exhibition

image.altText: Andrew Barr press conference

props.synopsis: The ACT's population is younger than the national average with a higher educational attainment and a solid progressive inclination, making the formula for winning power unlike anywhere else in the country.

title.children: The formula for winning power in the ACT is unlike anywhere else in the country

image.altText: Police searching for evidence on a road.

props.synopsis: Delivery driver Vikas Sharma was driving down Queanbeyan's Bungendore Road around 1am on Wednesday when he was waved down by a man in a "bad condition".

title.children: 'Please help me, I'm dying': Passing driver helps bleeding victim of Queanbeyan stabbing attack

image.altText: A man wearing a polo shirt with the logo 'MTP' sits in the driver's seat of a car.

props.synopsis: Differing promises for roads and public transport have become key points of contention and difference between ACT Labor, the Canberra Liberals and the ACT Greens in the coming territory election.

title.children: If York catches a bus to work, it takes more than an hour. It takes just 25 minutes for him to drive

image.altText: A snowy mountain with trees.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the death of Andrew Seton, who was an experienced skier missing in the NSW Snowy Mountains, has found police should have started the search earlier.

title.children: Coroner says Canberra man who died while skiing should have been registered as missing

image.altText: People dressed in bright rainbow colours stand on a rainbow mural in Canberra.

props.synopsis: The Fair Day at Canberra pride festival SpringOut will no longer have a police presence after some members of the LGBTQIA+ community raised concerns.

title.children: 'There is genuine fear about having cops there': Police asked not to attend Canberra pride festival

image.altText: A woman with brown short hair sits behind a microphone

props.synopsis: The public service commissioner names former department bosses Kathryn Campbell and Renee Leon among a dozen current and former senior public servants found to have breached their duties in relation to the unlawful Robodebt scheme.

title.children: Former department bosses Kathryn Campbell and Renee Leon found to have breached duties over Robodebt

image.altText: A man wearing a suit seated, with parts of the Russian flag in the background

props.synopsis: Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) says it has revoked the accreditation of six British diplomats in Moscow whose actions it said showed signs of spying and sabotage work.

title.children: Russia expels six British diplomats in response to 'numerous unfriendly steps' taken by UK

image.altText: A thoroughly destroyed light aircraft lying in a paddock.

props.synopsis: A witness has described trying to come to the aid of a man who died in a light plane crash in central Victoria.

title.children: Pilot dies in central Victorian light plane crash

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says the decision to strip medals from former army commanders in the same week the royal commission into veteran suicide was released was an "insensitive" move by Defence Minister Richard Marles.

title.children: 'Insensitivity': Dutton accuses defence minister of disservice to diggers in timing of decision to strip medals

image.altText: Brian To'o of the Panthers (centre) celebrates with teammates after scoring a try

props.synopsis: Four tries in the opening 25 minutes have guided the Penrith Panthers to a qualifying final win over the Sydney Roosters. Follow live.

title.children: Panthers into another preliminary final after first half blitz sets up win over Roosters

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FULL-TIME: Penrith Panthers 30 def. Sydney Roosters 10
71' TRY: Panthers score and have one foot in the prelim final
43' TRY: Roosters score their first try

image.altText: Jack Ginnivan pushes Jason Horne-Francis

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide is desperate to shake off the tag of finals chokers in front of its home crowd. In order to do so, the Power will have to beat Hawthorn, the hottest team in the AFL. Follow live.

title.children: 'Seriously, this is a final': Epic clash marred by dubious umpiring calls as Port and Hawthorn go down to the wire

image.altText: Donald Trump opens his hands wide as he speaks at a podium

props.synopsis: Here's how a baseless claim about Haitian migrants made it onto the US presidential debate stage.

title.children: A man claimed migrants were killing ducks in the park. In just two weeks, that rumour had spread to Donald Trump

image.altText: the outside of a casino building

props.synopsis: The Star casino has 14 days to explain why it shouldn't face disciplinary action after a scandalous report found it wasn't fit to hold a licence.

title.children: Star Sydney given two weeks to show why it shouldn't lose licence and be fined $100m

image.altText: A group of young Chinese men in white shirts stand on a production line inspecting items.

props.synopsis: The retirement age extension is considered long overdue by economists, with the current age of 60 for men and 50 or 55 for women depending on their jobs not having changed since the 1950s.

title.children: China announces new retirement ages, plans to foster 'new culture of marriage and child-bearing'

image.altText: A close up of Yvonne Buters wearing a black shirt with white flowers on it, looking directly into the camera.

props.synopsis: Stronger protections for older Australians and hefty fines for providers who breach standards are part of the federal government's sweeping changes to the aged care sector.

title.children: Woman whose parents deteriorated quickly in aged care hopes new laws will hold providers accountable

image.altText: Kim Jong Un with two men in military uniform and two men in white shirts standing among rows of grey pipes.

props.synopsis: North Korea has offered its first glimpse into a secretive facility used to produce weapons-grade uranium.

title.children: North Korea offers first glimpse of secretive weapons-grade uranium facility — see inside

image.altText: a man walking with cameras in front following

props.synopsis: A second man accused of the murder of Gold Coast woman Kelly Wilkinson has been acquitted by a jury and will be released after more than three years in custody.

title.children: Man acquitted of killing Gold Coast woman Kelly Wilkinson

image.altText: Police officers surround a woman in a car.

props.synopsis: A woman who set her hand in concrete as part of a protest against the Land Forces expo has been charged by police as the demonstration against the event continues for a third day.

title.children: Woman who set hand in concrete charged in Melbourne as Land Forces expo protest enters third day

image.altText: Woman in orange top looking at camera

props.synopsis: Questions are being raised about what a democratic process means as 14 local government areas in NSW appoint candidates to office without elections because of a lack of nominees.

title.children: Council candidate shortage sees 14 NSW local government areas have no vote on September 14

image.altText: Casey Munro sits at his desk in his spare room patting his cat

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission is reviewing whether administrative workers should be included under an award that would give them the right to work from home.

title.children: More Aussie workers may have the right to work from home

image.altText: Ilya Fomin stands near a front door

props.synopsis: Despite consulting with bank staff before transferring his life savings, Ilya Fomin lost $280,000 to scammers. His bank hasn't accepted any responsibility — new scam laws may change that.

title.children: First homebuyer loses $280K in scam despite asking bank staff to check transaction was legitimate

image.altText: Josh Addo-Carr looks to the side

props.synopsis: The Bulldogs have been informed that Josh Addo-Carr tested positive for cocaine in a random roadside drug test last Friday.

title.children: Addo-Carr returns positive cocaine test days out from Bulldogs finals return

image.altText: A man standing in a park

props.synopsis: The ex-girlfriend of an alleged serial killer has told the state's Supreme Court that he said he'd "bury her" if she "opened her mouth" after witnessing one of the alleged murders.

title.children: Alleged serial killer told ex-girlfriend he'd 'bury her in the pines' if she 'opened her mouth', court hears

image.altText: A close up shot of police tape with cars parked on a street and trees blurred in the background

props.synopsis: Five boys and five girls including a 13-year-old will front court after a police sting targeting property offences across more than 10 suburbs.

title.children: Ten teens arrested after spate of alleged thefts across the Sunshine Coast

image.altText: Ly Yong Phat sits next to several women at an event.

props.synopsis: The United States announces sanctions on one of Cambodia's wealthiest and most powerful tycoons over alleged human rights abuses related to the treatment of trafficking victims forced to work in online scam centres.

title.children: US sanctions powerful Cambodian tycoon over alleged human rights abuses in scam operations

image.altText: A mosaic of news photos, some fake and AI-created, including one of Taylor Swift, with blue ticks and red exclamation marks

props.synopsis: Every time you pick up your phone, you have to decide what's true and what's fake. And it's getting harder.

title.children: Most Australians struggle to spot what's real and what's fake. Here's some help

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers, Minister for Aged Care Anika Wells and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: This week saw a huge flurry of government activity — it's as if the government looked up at the clock and saw time was rapidly getting away from it. But what loomed largest was tying down the aged care deal.

title.children: Why Dutton backed Albanese's aged care reforms

image.altText: Ukrainian servicemen ride a military vehicle.

props.synopsis: Moscow's forces begin a counteroffensive in the Kursk region, claiming to have recaptured 10 settlements seized by Ukrainian forces in a surprise incursion into western Russia last month.

title.children: 'They will outnumber them': Russia begins counter-offensive in Kursk

image.altText: A picture of an elderly woman with a younger woman.

props.synopsis: Some experts say Australia needs to focus on prevention and strengthening primary care to effectively deal with the projected rise in dementia.

title.children: The number of Australians living with dementia projected to more than double by 2058

image.altText: A man with tattoos on his shoulders sits in a bath and looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: Clearance divers have among the highest suicide rates of all defence personnel. An ABC investigation has spoken to more than a dozen former divers experiencing a cluster of symptoms they believe is connected to blast exposure.

title.children: These men knew signing up to the Navy would be risky. The toll on their brains wasn't revealed until years later

image.altText: An aerial shot, rendered, showing the roofs of three buildings and a courtyard connecting them

props.synopsis: Established suburbs are often left out of the housing crisis discussion, but an architecture expert has an innovative idea that could be part of the solution.

title.children: Many families dream of living in a leafy older suburb. Here's a new way to make that possible for more people
